messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
This is someone with the transfer for police, fire, or medical.
Alright, hello? I can't hear you clearly. Please speak up.
Yes, I need an ambulance. 241 Domerick Drive.
Okay, you need an ambulance. Can you tell me what happened?
My son just stabbed me. He just stabbed me.
He stabbed you? Is he still there with you?
Yes, he is.
I'm transferring you to the fire department. Please stay on the line.
Orange County Fire Rescue, this is a call transfer.
Yes, I'm here. What is your nearest cross street?
Horatio and Dommer Drive.
Got it. And what's the phone number you're calling from?
Okay, here it is. My son is psychotic. I should have taken him to the hospital, but he stabbed me with a butter knife.
How old is your son, ma'am?
He's 18.
Is he conscious right now?
Yes, he is.
Is he still being violent?
I hope not, but the longer we take, the worse it might get.
Does he still have the weapon?
No, but he's looking for one.
Where is he now?
He's right next to me.
Ma'am, what is your name?
Diana May. M.A.Y.
And your son's name?
Alex May. M.A.Y.
Can you go lock yourself in a room? Maybe a bedroom or a bathroom?
Yes, I'm doing that.
Are there any guns in the house?
No, there are no guns.
What did he go to pick up?
Now he has one of those... I can't believe he did this. I don't know what's wrong with him.
I need you to stay calm. Is there anything else he could use as a weapon?
He went to the bathroom. No, no, don't do it! Don't do it!
